back: Given a $n \times n$ square matrix $\mathbf{A}$, the inverse matrix (if it is exists) is a $n \times n$ matrix denoted $\mathbf{A}^{-1}$ such that \begin{equation*} \mathbf{A}^{-1} \mathbf{A} = \mathbf{I}. \end{equation*}
A square matrix $\mathbf{A}$ is invertible if its inverse $\mathbf{A}^{-1}$ exists; this corresponds to $\mathbf{A}$ having full rank.
